docs.snippet: On Sunday afternoon, Feb. 19, a great mass meeting of the English-speaksng Roman Catholics of the city was held in the St. Patrick's Church. The meeting was composed entirely of Irishmen; very few females being observed present.

headline.main: Sympathy for the Pope.; MEETING OF ROMAN CATHOLICS IN MONTREAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Sunday afternoon, Feb. 19, a great mass meeting of the English-speaksng Roman Catholics of the city was held in the St. Patrick's Church. The meeting was composed entirely of Irishmen; very few females being observed present.

docs.snippet: Twenty years ago the British Government was aroused to the pressing necessity of investigating the causes of the frightful mortality of her laboring population, and Commissioners of scientific men were delegated to traverse the realm and thoroughly...

headline.main: Can the Public Health be Improved?

docs.lead_paragraph: Twenty years ago the British Government was aroused to the pressing necessity of investigating the causes of the frightful mortality of her laboring population, and Commissioners of scientific men were delegated to traverse the realm and thoroughly explore its cities and towns and discover, if possible, the secret sources of death. England underwent a complete and thorough sanitary survey, and the admirable Reports of the Health of Towns Commissioners exhibit the result.

docs.snippet: The Spring Book Trade gives pleasant indications of health and vigor. Most of the City Publishers are renewing their stock and issuing new works, in anticipation of an increased demand.

THOUVENEL, French Secretary for Foreign Affairs, to the French Ambassadors at the several European Courts, to which our telegraphic dispatch has already alluded. headline.main: CITY GOVERMENT.; THE ALDERMEN AND STREET-CLEANING. THE MAYOR AND COMPTROLLER BEFORE THE COMMITTEE OF INVESTIGATION-- COMPARATIVE VIEWS OF THE COST OF STREET-CLEANING--THE AGREEMENT WITH MR. SMITH--POWERS OF THE CITY INSPECTOR.

Saturday, in room No. 8 City Hall, for the purpose of Instituting an investigation with regard to the agreement entered into by the City Inspector with Mr. R.A. headline.main: HEALTH LAWS FOR NEW YORK AND BROOKLYN

docs.snippet: In the House of Lords, on the 16th of February, the Earl of AIRLIE moved for copies of all correspondence between the Government and Lord COWLEY and Mr. COBDEN, respecting the negotiation of the treaty of commerce with France. He stated that his...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the House of Lords, on the 16th of February, the Earl of AIRLIE moved for copies of all correspondence between the Government and Lord COWLEY and Mr. COBDEN, respecting the negotiation of the treaty of commerce with France. He stated that his object was to obtain some explanation of an article in the treaty which bound England not to prohibit the export of coal.
